sen.j: 十市 遠忠（とおち・とおいち とおただ）1497年（明応6年）-1545年（天文14年）、室町時代-戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Tada TOCHI (Tochi, Toichi) (1497-1545) was the busho (Japanese military commander), who lived between Muromachi and Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).
sen.cmt: 原文には年号がなかったのですが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると (1497-1545) となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: Tada TOCHI (Tochi, Toichi) (1497-1545) was a busho (Japanese military commander), who lived between the Muromachi and Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).
Tada TOCHI (1497 - 1545) was a busho (Japanese military commander), who lived between the Muromachi and Sengoku period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).
sen.cmt: (Tochi, Toichi)不要と考え削除しました。スペース補足しました。period小文字にしました。

sen.j: 十市遠治の子。
sen.e: He was the child of Toharu TOCHI.
He was the child of Toharu TOCHI.
He was the child of Toharu TOCHI.

sen.j: 大和国龍王山城主。
sen.e: He was the head of castellan of Ryuosan-jo Castle in Yamato Province.
He was the head castellan of Ryuosan-jo Castle in Yamato Province.
He was the head castellan of Ryuosan-jo Castle in Yamato Province.

sen.j: 官位は兵部少輔。
sen.e: His court rank was Hyobu shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of War).
His court rank was Hyobu shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of War).
His court rank was Hyobu shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of War).

sen.j: 遠忠は武勇に優れ、歌道（三条西実隆に師事）や書道にも通じ、文武両道の武将として十市氏の最盛期を築いたとされる。
sen.e: Totada excelled in martial art as well as being skilled in kado (waka poetry study) (studied under Sanetaka SANJONISHI) and calligraphy, and he led the height of Tochi Clan as the busho of both the literary and military arts.

Totada excelled in martial art as well as being skilled in kado (waka poetry study) (studied under Sanetaka SANJONISHI) and calligraphy, and he led the height of Tochi Clan as the busho of both the literary and military arts.

Totada excelled in martial art as well as being skilled in kado (waka poetry study) (studied under Sanetaka SANJONISHI) and calligraphy, and he led the height of Tochi clan as the busho of both the literary and military arts.

sen.j: 最大領域は十市郡・式上郡等大和国北西部を占め、遠く伊賀国までその領地を広げた。
sen.e: The biggest estate included Toichi and Shikijo Counties of northwestern Yamato Province and expanded his estate to the Iga Province far away.
The biggest estate included Toichi and Shikijo Counties of northwestern Yamato Province and expanded his estate to the Iga Province far away.
The biggest estate included Toichi and Shikijo Districts of northwestern Yamato Province and expanded his estate to the Iga Province far away.

sen.j: 推定石高は6万石。
sen.e: The estimated kokudaka (crop yield) of the estate was sixty thousand koku (approximately ten thousand eight hundred and twenty-three cubic meters of crop yield).
The estimated kokudaka (crop yield) of the estate was sixty thousand koku (approximately ten thousand eight hundred and twenty-three cubic meters of crop yield).
The estimated kokudaka (crop yield) of the estate was 60,000 koku (approximately 10,823 cubic meters of crop yield).

sen.j: 1528、畠山氏の重臣木沢長政が大和国へ侵攻した際に舅の筒井順昭と袂を分かち、木沢・筒井氏と戦った。
sen.e: 1528: He allied with his father-in-law, Junsho TSUTSUI, and fought with Kizawa and Tsutsui Clans when Nagamasa KIZAWA, who was the a chief retainer of Hatakeyama clan, invaded Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 原文には年号がなかったのですが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると1528となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: 1528: He allied with his father-in-law, Junsho TSUTSUI, and fought with the Kizawa and Tsutsui Clans when Nagamasa KIZAWA, who was the chief retainer of the Hatakeyama clan, invaded Yamato Province.
1528: He allied with his father-in-law, Junsho TSUTSUI, and fought with the Kizawa and Tsutsui clans when Nagamasa KIZAWA, who was the chief retainer of the Hatakeyama clan, invaded Yamato Province.

sen.j: 1532年（天文元年）7月、大和一向宗と興福寺衆徒の間で天文法華の乱が起こる。興福寺焼ける。
sen.e: August 1532: Tenbun Hokke War occurred between Yamato Ikko Sect and monk-soldiers of Kofuku-ji Temple, and Kofuku-ji Temple burnt down.
sen.cmt: ウェブで確認した際、原文にはこの文章がぬけていたので、本来はこちらの文章を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: August 1532: The Tenbun Hokke War occurred between the Yamato Ikko Sect and monk-soldiers of the Kofuku-ji Temple, and the Kofuku-ji Temple burnt down.
August 1532: The Tenbun Hokke War occurred between the Yamato Ikko Sect and monk-soldiers of the Kofuku-ji Temple, and the Kofuku-ji Temple burnt down.

sen.j: 8月、一向一揆、高取城の越智家栄を攻めるが筒井氏、十市氏の活躍で潰滅。
sen.e: September 1532: He suppressed Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers), Iehide OCHI of Takatori-jo Castle, but was defeated by Tsutsui and Tochi Clans.
sen.cmt: ウェブで確認した際、原文にはこの文章がぬけていたので、本来はこちらの文章を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: September 1532: He suppressed Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers), Iehide OCHI of Takatori-jo Castle, but was defeated by the Tsutsui and Tochi Clans.
September 1532: He suppressed Ikko Ikki (an uprising of Ikko sect followers), Iehide OCHI of Takatori-jo Castle, but was defeated by the Tsutsui and Tochi clans.

sen.j: 1533、父の死を受けて家督を継ぐ（家督を継いだのは1528年以前とも）。
sen.e: 1533: He took over the family head position due to the death of his father (it is also said that he inherited the position prior to 1528).
sen.cmt: 原文には年号がなかったのですが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると1533となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: 1533: He took over the family head position due to the death of his father (it is also said that he inherited the position prior to 1528).
1533: He took over the family head position due to the death of his father (it is also said that he inherited the position prior to 1528).

sen.j: 1536、龍王山にあった城を改修し、北側に新たに城を築いて南北一体の大規模な城を築いた。
sen.e: 1536: He reconstructed the castle at Ryuosan Mountain, and built another castle toward the north side and built the huge castle that combined North and Southern areas.
sen.cmt: 原文には年号がなかったのですが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると1536となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: 1536: He reconstructed the castle at Ryuosan Mountain, and built another castle toward the north side and built the huge castle that combined North and Southern areas.
1536: He reconstructed the castle at Ryuosan Mountain, and built another castle toward the north side and built the huge castle that combined North and Southern areas.

sen.j: その後、居城を十市城（現・奈良県橿原市十市町）から龍王山城に移している。
sen.e: He later moved into Ryuosan Castle from Toichi-jo Castle (the current Toichi Town, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture).
He later moved into Ryuosan Castle from Toichi-jo Castle (the current Toichi Town, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture).
He later moved into Ryuosan Castle from Toichi-jo Castle (the current Toichi Town, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 1月21日、春日社参し御幣料1貫・神楽料5貫備進する。（春日大社文書852）
sen.e: He went to pray at Kasuga-sha Shrine and donated one gohei (wooden wands, decorated with two Shide (zigzag paper streamers)) and five fee for Kagura (a musical dance) (Manuscript of Kasuga-sha Shrine Eight hundred and fifty-two).
sen.cmt: ウェブで確認した際、原文にはこの文章がぬけていたので、本来はこちらの文章を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: He went to pray at Kasuga-sha Shrine and donated one gohei (wooden wands, decorated with two Shide (zigzag paper streamers)) and five fees for Kagura (a musical dance) (Manuscript of Kasuga-sha Shrine Eight hundred and fifty-two).

He went to pray at Kasuga-sha Shrine and donated one gohei (wooden wands, decorated with two Shide (zigzag paper streamers)) and five fees for Kagura (a musical dance) (Manuscript of Kasuga-sha Shrine No. 852).

sen.j: 1538年（天文7年）、2月29日 大和国興福寺供目代御房へ大仏供上庄外護職を請けて忠勤を約束する。（春日神社文書）
sen.e: March 29, 1538: He received the position of Mokudai (Deputy) monk of Kofuku-ji Temple in Yamato Province to create the position of 大仏供上庄外護職 and promised to work hard (according to the manuscripts by Kasuga-jinja Shrine).
sen.cmt: ウェブで確認した際、原文にはこの文章がぬけていたので、本来はこちらの文章を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました, 大仏供上庄外護職 [定訳不明]
sen.e: March 29, 1538: He received the position of Mokudai (Deputy) monk of the Kofuku-ji Temple in Yamato Province to create the position of 大仏供上庄外護職 and promised to work hard (according to the manuscripts by Kasuga-jinja Shrine).

April 8, 1538: He received the position of Mokudai (Deputy) monk of the Kofuku-ji Temple in Yamato Province to create the position of 大仏供上庄外護職 and promised to work hard (according to the manuscripts by Kasuga-jinja Shrine).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 1540年（天文9年）、９月筒井順昭と和す。
sen.e: October 1540: He signed a truce with Junsho TSUTSUI.
sen.cmt: ウェブで確認した際、原文にはこの文章がぬけていたので、本来はこちらの文章を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: October 1540: He signed a truce with Junsho TSUTSUI.
October 1540: He signed a truce with Junsho TSUTSUI.

sen.j: 1542、木沢長政が河内国で討死するとそれに乗じて勢力を拡大した。
sen.e: 1542: When Nagamasa KIZAWA died in the battle in Kawachi Province, he took the opportunity to expand his forces.
sen.cmt: 原文には年号がなかったのですが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると1542となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
sen.e: 1542: When Nagamasa KIZAWA died in the battle in Kawachi Province, he took the opportunity to expand his forces.
1542: When Nagamasa KIZAWA died in the battle in Kawachi Province, he took the opportunity to expand his forces.

sen.j: 遠忠の死後、家督は嫡子十市遠勝が継いだ。
sen.e: After the death of Totada, his legal son, Tokatsu TOCHI, inherited the family head position.
After the death of Totada, his legal son, Tokatsu TOCHI, inherited the family head position.
After the death of Totada, his legal son, Tokatsu TOCHI, inherited the family head position.

sen.j: 遠忠が詠んだ和歌等を収めた『十市遠忠百首』『十市遠忠百番自歌合』等が遺されている。
sen.e: "A hundred poems by Totada Tochi" and "Toichi Totada Hyakuban jikaawase (self poetry contest)" had a collection of waka read by Totada.
"A hundred poems by Totada Tochi" and "Toichi Totada Hyakuban jikaawase (self poetry contest)" were a collection of waka read by Totada.
"A hundred poems by Totada Tochi" and "Toichi Totada Hyakuban jikaawase" (self poetry contest) were a collection of waka read by Totada.
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 系譜
sen.e: Genealogy

sen.j: 室:名前不詳（筒井順興の娘）
sen.e: Wife: Name is unknown (daughter of Junko TSUTSUI).
sen.cmt: ウェブで確認した際、原文にはこの文章がぬけていたので、本来はこちらの文章を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました

sen.e: Child: Tokatsu TOCHI

sen.j: 子:十市遠長（常陸介）
sen.e: Child: Tonaga TOCHI, who had the title of Hitachi no suke (Assistant Governor of Hitachi Province).
sen.cmt: ウェブで確認した際、原文にはこの文章がぬけていたので、本来はこちらの文章を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました
